channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: July was the first month in over a year that didn’t set a heat record
item.description: It is the second-warmest July and second-warmest of any month recorded in the agency's records, behind only July 2023.

item.title: 5 things to know before the stock market opens Thursday
item.description: Here are the most important news items that investors need to start their trading day.

item.title: Why your days of sharing passwords for Disney+, Hulu and Max are numbered
Italy doubles its ‘billionaires tax’ to €200,000 for super-rich expats
item.description: 1,186 high-net-worth individuals have transferred their tax residency to Italy since the policy was first introduced in 2017.

item.title: Eli Lilly blows past estimates, hikes guidance as Zepbound, Mounjaro sales soar
item.description: The success of Eli Lilly's weight loss and diabetes drugs Zepbound and Mounjaro caused the company to hike its guidance.

item.title: Costco to start scanning membership cards on entry, as sales notch another gain
Hyundai debuts a new EV facility in Thailand, as the ‘Detroit of Asia’ pivots to making electric cars
item.description: The Korean carmaker is pushing into Thailand right as Chinese EVs are starting to pull ahead of Japanese brands.

item.title: A guide to the wild week of trading, from Monday's 'flash crash' to the yen to the volatility spike
item.description: There is a difference between a bear market and a correction. Investors would do well to keep calm when fear rattles stocks.

item.title: Stock market likely to retest lows in 4-step recovery process, history suggests
Jamie Dimon is done psychoanalyzing the Fed
item.description: "Every day 325 million Americans go to work, go to their jobs, take care of their families, take care of their kids, build out their house, change a job. And it could be affected by the Fed changing rates by 50 base points? I don't think so."

item.title: Restaurant Brands revenue tops estimates, fueled by Tim Hortons
item.description: Canadian coffee chain Tim Hortons was the restaurant company's strongest performer during the quarter.

item.title: U.S. stocks close lower as Dow logs worst 5-day start to a month in 6 years
75% of carry trade blamed in recent stock meltdown has been unwound, JPMorgan says
item.description: The carry strategy — which involves borrowing at low rates to fund purchases in higher-yielding assets elsewhere — has been wobbling for months.

item.title: Deliveroo shares jump 8% after posting first-ever profit on 'inflection' in consumer demand
item.description: Deliveroo made a net profit of £1.3 million ($1.7 million) in the six months through June, bouncing from a loss last year.

item.title: Facebook parent Meta seeks to raise $10.5 billion in bonds
